dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2391 IH: No Crime Left Behind Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Slotkin (for herself, Ms. Kuster, and Mr. Trone) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to temporarily prohibit the transfer of a firearm to, or the possession of a firearm by, a person convicted of a misdemeanor in which a firearm was used, carried, or possessed.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Crime Left Behind Act.

section.header: Temporary prohibition on the transfer of a firearm to, or the possession of a firearm by, a person convicted of a misdemeanor in which a firearm was used, carried, or possessed

subsection.text: Section 922(d) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or at the end of paragraph (10);
by inserting after paragraph (10) the following:
during the preceding 3 years, completed a sentence imposed under law for a misdemeanor in which a firearm was used, carried, or possessed; or

subsection.text: Section 922(g) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking or at the end of paragraph (8)(C)(ii);
by striking the comma at the end of paragraph (9) and inserting ; or; and
by inserting after paragraph (9) the following:
who, during the preceding 3 years, completed a sentence imposed under law for a misdemeanor in which a firearm was used, carried, or possessed,

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and shall not apply with respect to any sentence imposed for a misdemeanor conviction entered before such date of enactment.
